qas.question: Who was Tito's best known wife?
How old was Jovanka Broz when she married Tito?
In what year did Tito and Jovanka marry?
Who was the best man at the wedding of Jovanka and Tito?
Who went down in history as Yugoslavia's first lady?

context: His best known wife was <a0_0>Jovanka Broz<a0_0/>. Tito was just shy of his 59th birthday, while she was <a1_0>27<a1_0/>, when they finally married in April <a2_0>1952<a2_0/>, with state security chief <a3_0>Aleksandar Ranković<a3_0/> as the best man. Their eventual marriage came about somewhat unexpectedly since Tito actually rejected her some years earlier when his confidante Ivan Krajacic brought her in originally. At that time, she was in her early 20s and Tito, objecting to her energetic personality, opted for the more mature opera singer Zinka Kunc instead. Not one to be discouraged easily, Jovanka continued working at Beli Dvor, where she managed the staff and eventually got another chance after Tito's strange relationship with Zinka failed. Since <a4_0>Jovanka<a4_0/> was the only female companion he married while in power, she also went down in history as Yugoslavia's first lady. Their relationship was not a happy one, however. It had gone through many, often public, ups and downs with episodes of infidelities and even allegations of preparation for a coup d'état by the latter pair. Certain unofficial reports suggest Tito and Jovanka even formally divorced in the late 1970s, shortly before his death. However, during Tito's funeral she was officially present as his wife, and later claimed rights for inheritance. The couple did not have any children.
